intro: Parosela submontana, commonly known as the mountain parosela, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations ranging from 1,000 to 2,500 meters. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Parosela submontana is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators in alpine ecosystems.
